alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Raton Crews Airport, or 13 miles southeast of Raton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Capulin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 444 and 445. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 342 and 343, and between Mile Markers 354 and 378. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
